intro: Scleria trigona, commonly known as the three-angled sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, three-lobed flowers in clusters. Scleria trigona typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in areas with consistent moisture. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
